subject: RE: [junit] assertNotEquals
msgSnippet: I like that approach much better since it relies on the framework.  Thanks a lot! -Brian ... From: mrettig@homemail.com To: junit@yahoogroups.com Sent: 2/21/01
messageBody:
I like that approach much better since it relies on the framework. Thanks a
lot!

-Brian

-----Original Message-----
From: mrettig@...
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 2/21/01 12:08 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] assertNotEquals


Brian Robinson wrote:
>Has anyone written an assertNotEquals method?

This method simply uses the standard method assertEquals method. This
way you can reuse the overloaded assertEquals method.

How about:
public void assertNotEquals(Object shouldNotBe, Object actual){
assertNotEquals(null, shouldNotBe, actual);
}

public void assertNotEquals(String msg, Object shouldNotBe, Object
actual){
String formatted= "";
if (message != null)
formatted= message+" ";

boolean isEqual = false;
try{
assertEquals(shouldNotBe, actual);
isEqual = true;
{
catch(Throwable valuesNotEqual){
isEqual = false;
}
if(!isEqual)
fail(formatted+"expected:<"+shouldNotBe+">
equaled:<"+actual+">");
}
